review: i give Fire TV Stick three stars because it was registered to me, connected easily and works.  the quick guide could have pointed out the Options selection for closed captioning.  i removed stars for a few reasons. As widely noted on forums, the removal of the battery cover for the remote, which is the first thing we have to do, is too tight and has no grip to it, too slippery. you can't get started with your new Fire Stick without this frustrating struggle. In the end a sharp knife or nail file, (one person used a screwdriver) is needed to slip in and click open the cover.  Second, i did use the adapter so I could fit the stick in the port in the back of the TV. even that just fit in the area for plugging in cables. It was hard to manipulate to click it in. Third, the menu on the left is too grayed out. That is, you can see what you've landed on and highlighted but it's very hard to see what the other choices are unless you sit close. and i have a large screen tv.  Fourth, i don't find it easy for browsing or shopping or searching, so to speak. i still go back to the app on my iPad to find new programs of interest. I only use it for my Amazon Prime membership, to play what i already own or anything I find by clicking around on the home screen. I do not subscribe to Netflix or Hulu so i can't comment on those services or others. i looked at Games but am not interested in paying. .I did download the Fire TV Stick app to my phone. It works but seems unnecessary unless i lose the remote or don't have batteries. Overall I am happy to have this device so i don't have to stream videos through the internet using my mobile devices. the connection to the tv with Apple devices used the power port so we are limited in how long we can watch. Fire TV Stick takes care of that. I wish there was a low cost portable device with a screen associated with the Fire Stick so I could easily store shows  and travel on an airplane with, so as not to have to download to my phone or ipad.

review: I ordered this when Amazon offered the $19.99. I planned on using this in my bedroom but for some reason it would not work with my bedroom television (maybe because it is a 2008 Model). I also have a Fire TV I had planned on using in the living room. Long story short I tried the stick in the living room plugged into my home theater receiver and it works perfectly. I moved the Fire TV to the bedroom and I really cannot tell a difference it the two. My Fire TV stick has been very fast, smooth and responsive. I use it mostly for Amazon instant video, Netflix, watchespn, and I have set up a plex server and use the plex app to access it and all have worked smoothly with very good picture and sound. I thought there may be a noticeable difference in performance between the Fire TV and the Stick but I have not noticed any. I am very satisfied with both and would recommend either to anyone interested.

review: If you already have an Amazon Prime account, you need to get this for all the free entertainment. It pays for itself. If you don't get one, you are wasting one of the advantages of having a Prime account.The device came with everything I needed to set it up and pre-loaded with my Prime account information (how do they do that!?!), so all I did was plug it into the USB port on my TV. Follow the on-screen instructions to connect to your WiFi (or you can plug it directly into your router), and you are done. The controls and menus are simple and easy to navigate.
